UpdatingProjects.Overview: Learn how to update projects to a newer version of Unreal Engine using built-in features.
UpdatingProjects.Note: Once updated, projects cannot be opened in older versions. Convert a copy first.

Steps.Description: Launch the newer Unreal Engine version.
Find the project in the Unreal Project Browser. Use the search bar if needed.
Select the project tile and click Open.
In the dialog, click Open a Copy. More Options are available.

Options.Warning: May cause data corruption if conversion fails.
May cause data loss if project fails to open.

ConversionResult.Failure: Error log displayed; manual resolution required.

RecoveryHub.Overview: Plugin to help recover an Unreal Engine session after a crash or abnormal exit.
RecoveryHub.Note: Recovery Hub was called Disaster Recovery in Unreal Engine 4. Not enabled by default.
RecoveryHub.DiskSpaceWarning: Assets > 2GB will consume significant disk space. Disable if space is low.

HowItWorks.Description: On launch, checks for abnormal session end, replays transactions to recover work.
HowItWorks.Transactions: Records changes as transactions, can roll back to previous state if crashed.
HowItWorks.Support: Supports Level editing and Sequencer, works with autosave files.

RecoveryHub.EnablingAutosave: Enable from General > Saving & Loading in Editor Preferences.

Interface.ConfigurationsButton: Opens plugin settings in Project Settings.
Interface.SessionDetails: Displays transactions of the selected session.

CreatingCustomTemplates.Overview: Steps for converting an existing project to a template in Unreal Engine.
CreatingCustomTemplates.Description: Templates provide a starting point for projects, allowing custom configurations including content, settings, and plugins.

Steps.Description: Copy the project's folder to the Templates folder in the Unreal Engine installation directory.
For source-compiled Unreal Engine, locate the Templates folder at [ForkLocation]\UE4\Templates.
Update the [ProjectName]\Config\DefaultGame.ini file with the ProjectName variable.
Copy TemplateDefs.ini from an existing template folder to the [ProjectName]\Config folder.
Update LocalizedDisplayNames and LocalizedDescriptions in TemplateDefs.ini for each supported language.

Example.Description: LocalizedDescriptions=(Language="en",Text="This is a custom template that includes a first-person character and uses Blueprint.")

Steps.Description: Assign a category to the template in TemplateDefs.ini. Options: Games, ME, AEC, MFG.
Add icon and preview images in the [ProjectName]\Media folder (PNG format). Naming: Icon: [ProjectName].png, Preview: [ProjectName]_Preview.png.

CreatingCustomTemplates.EndResult: The new template will appear in the New Project dialog. Restart Unreal Engine to see changes.
